org.apache.mesos.specification

Class DefaultTaskSpecification

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.specification.DefaultTaskSpecification
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaskSpecification

    public class DefaultTaskSpecification
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskSpecification
    This class provides a default implementation of the TaskSpecification interface.

      Returns the Mesos Protos.CommandInfo to be used for the starting task.
      java.util.Collection<ConfigFileSpecification> getConfigFiles()
      Returns the Configuration Files to be written for this task, or an empty list if no custom configurations should be written.
      java.util.Optional<Protos.HealthCheck> getHealthCheck()
      Returns the health check operation to be performed against this task while it's running, or an empty Optional if no additional health checks should be performed beyond Mesos task status.

      Returns the name of this task.
      java.util.Optional<PlacementRuleGenerator> getPlacement()
      Returns the placement constraint for this task.

      Returns the container resources required by tasks of this type, or an empty list if no container resources are necessary.
      java.lang.String getType()
      The type of a TaskSpecification should be the name of the TaskSet to which it belongs.

      • getResources

        public java.util.Collection<ResourceSpecification> getResources()
        Description copied from interface: TaskSpecification
        Returns the container resources required by tasks of this type, or an empty list if no container resources are necessary. In practice you probably want something here. See the documentation for ResourceSpecification for more information.
        Specified by:
        getResources in interface TaskSpecification

      • getVolumes

        public java.util.Collection<VolumeSpecification> getVolumes()
        Description copied from interface: TaskSpecification
        Returns the persistent volumes required for this task, or an empty list if no persistent volumes are necessary, e.g. when not using persistent volumes. See the documentation for VolumeSpecification for more information.
        Specified by:
        getVolumes in interface TaskSpecification

      • getConfigFiles

        public java.util.Collection<ConfigFileSpecification> getConfigFiles()
        Description copied from interface: TaskSpecification
        Returns the Configuration Files to be written for this task, or an empty list if no custom configurations should be written. Note: There is a 512KB limit for all template data for a given task, to keep the resulting Mesos TaskInfo message from growing too large. If you need to exceed this limit, consider using resource files.
        Specified by:
        getConfigFiles in interface TaskSpecification

      • getPlacement

        public java.util.Optional<PlacementRuleGenerator> getPlacement()
        Description copied from interface: TaskSpecification
        Returns the placement constraint for this task. This can be anything from "colocate with another task", "ensure instances are only launched on nodes with attribute X", etc. This may return an empty Optional if no specific placement rules are applicable. See the documentation for PlacementRuleGenerator and PlacementRule for more information.
        Specified by:
        getPlacement in interface TaskSpecification
